content: On August 18, 1991, the Atlanta Braves faced off against the Houston Astros in a pivotal game during their remarkable season. Tom Glavine delivered a stellar performance, pitching a complete game shutout and leading the Braves to a 3-0 victory. This win was part of a larger turnaround for the franchise, as the Braves would go on to clinch the National League West title that year, marking the beginning of their dominance in the 1990s. Glavine's strong outing on this date exemplified the pitching prowess that would become a hallmark of the Braves during that era.
